commit_message:
[WIP] Add two synthetic fields in PortFowarding object

Change-Id: I0079f46c153f7c2de12c98a9ae9d911659f3048b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/64/611464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fields_need_translation = { 'socket': obj_fields.StringField(), synthetic_fields = ['floating_ip_address', 'router_id', 'internal_ip_address', 'internal_port'] if attrname == 'internal_ip_address' or attrname == 'internal_port': return self._load_attrs_from_socket() def _load_attrs_from_socket(self): groups = self.socket.split(":") self.internal_ip_address = netaddr.IPAddress( groups[0], version=lib_const.IP_VERSION_4) self.internal_port = int(groups[1]) self.obj_reset_changes(['internal_ip_address', 'internal_port']) self._load_attrs_from_socket() def create(self): fields = self.obj_get_changes() if 'internal_ip_address' in fields and 'internal_port' in fields: self.socket = str( fields['internal_ip_address']) + ":" + str( fields['internal_port']) super(PortForwarding, self).create() def update(self): fields = self.obj_get_changes() if 'internal_ip_address' in fields and 'internal_port' in fields: self.socket = str( fields['internal_ip_address']) + ":" + str( fields['internal_port']) super(PortForwarding, self).update()
deleted_lines: # Notes: 'socket': 'socket' maybe odd here, but for current OVO and the # definition of PortForwarding obj, this obj doesn't define a field named # "socket", but the db model does, it will get the value to store into db. # And this obj defines some fields like "internal_ip_address" and # "internal_port" which will construct "socket" field. Also there is # a reason why it like this. Please see neutron/objects/base.py#n468 # So if we don't set it into fields_need_translation, the OVO base will # default skip the field from db. fields_need_translation = { 'socket': 'socket', synthetic_fields = ['floating_ip_address', 'router_id'] @classmethod def modify_fields_from_db(cls, db_obj): result = super(PortForwarding, cls).modify_fields_from_db(db_obj) if 'socket' in result: groups = result['socket'].split(":") result['internal_ip_address'] = netaddr.IPAddress( groups[0], version=lib_const.IP_VERSION_4) result['internal_port'] = int(groups[1]) del result['socket'] return result @classmethod def modify_fields_to_db(cls, fields): result = super(PortForwarding, cls).modify_fields_to_db(fields) if 'internal_ip_address' in result and 'internal_port' in result: result['socket'] = str( result['internal_ip_address']) + ":" + str( result['internal_port']) del result['internal_ip_address'] del result['internal_port'] return result

In test_user_account_lockout, we will check "If we wait the required

testcase should be skipped.

Change-Id: Ie8fc407633708066e60322f73cdfed1a0a0dbd20
'}]
commit_message:
Do not check account unlock if lockout config is 0

In test_user_account_lockout, if both CONF.identity.user_lockout_failure
_attempts and CONF.identity.user_lockout_duration are set to 0, the
testcase should be skipped.

Change-Id: Ie8fc407633708066e60322f73cdfed1a0a0dbd20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/14/611514/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If we wait the required time, the user account will be unlocked. # NOTE: If CONF.identity.user_lockout_duration is too long, just skip # this check. if CONF.identity.user_lockout_duration < 10: time.sleep(CONF.identity.user_lockout_duration + 1) self.non_admin_token.auth(user_id=self.user_id, password=password)
deleted_lines: # If we wait the required time, the user account will be unlocked time.sleep(CONF.identity.user_lockout_duration + 1) self.non_admin_token.auth(user_id=self.user_id, password=password)

commit_message:
playbooks: Convert venv_python_path to proper role

The venv_python_path tasks were in the roles directroy but we were
including it as a normal file with a list of tasks so it was not really
an Ansible role. This does not work well when we use the Bifrost roles
outside of bifrost since Ansible does not know where to find this file
for inclusion. Our best chance is to convert it to a simple role which
can be statically imported.

Change-Id: I82fdfe48f9f2eb631165ab630157bc378ddc631d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/98/610898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
doc: restructure the image building documentation

Main goal: consolidate the information about image
building under the same documentation page, and move
plugin-specific details inside plugin pages.
No plugin-specific information should live outside
those pages.

More details:
- move the detailed documentation about sahara-image-pack
  from the contributor guide to the new dedicated page
  in the user manual;
- remove the vanilla and cdh pages which describes building
  images with sahara-image-create, and move the common
  information to new sahara-image-create page
  in the user manual;
- add the matrix of supported plugin versions and
  supported building technology for each plugin inside
  the respective <plugin>-plugin.rst;
- add the redirects for the removed pages (only for master
  and rocky, where this change should be backported).
- remove few details not really needed (e.g. how to convert
  to VMDK images, location of cloud-init packages, etc,
  which do not really belong here).

Change-Id: I8398a7ad625276d8f11d743688ba71902a7e1adc

commit_message:
Update docs conf.py for openstackdocstheme change

A Starlingx patch[1] changed the signature for some openstackdocstheme
methods which is causing Octavia docs to not build.

This patch updates the octavia docs configuration for the new
openstackdocstheme.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607298

Change-Id: Id09ab3b78291c28e116f1f4ffb8836eac0537d94
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/87/611987/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add reflection of RpcPort to health checks

This patch passes RpcPort parameter value to container health check
scripts, which are based on verifying if service is connected to RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: If63f136b5173bb9a94572ea5062a188469c2c782
Closes-Bug: #1782369
(cherry picked from commit 7351b3cc204e9fed8543778bf9d36494b95b3af9)

added_lines: test: list_join: - ' ' - - '/openstack/healthcheck' - yaql: expression: str($.data.port) data: port: {get_attr: [NovaComputeBase, role_data, config_settings, 'nova::rabbit_port']}

commit_message:
Stop relying on old legacy sub_nodes_private

Use inventory variables in CI code for subnodes and
primray node.

commit_message:
Ignore doc build path

If you build the docs with `tox -edocs` and then run `tox -epep8`,
it will always fail because it checks the build output from the
docs. This change ignores the build folder.

Trivial-Fix
Change-Id: Ie7c53b517b7cfff1d317cad014371c94c6212eac

commit_message:
Restore OpenSUSE voting jobs

In https://review.openstack.org/609329 we had to disable
voting for the OpenSUSE jobs due to mirror issues. This
patch restores the jobs to voting again.

Change-Id: If2091627b3518d1e16127ff9706ad28bc3ce1502

commit_message:
Fix tests in test_public_ip.py

Looks like all the tests in test_public_ip.py were fundametaly broken
because of mocking *all* the methods of FipPubIpDriver causing the
tested method to not be exectued. This commit fixes that.

Closes-Bug: 1798782

Change-Id: I6286db8d70a111efc88292b47c631d0d81108cd2

subject: Run NetworkDeployment as async task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-18 20:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/templates/deployments.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/ac4ac838e1a3eda32bbf8e9c0a61a89142688194', 'message': 'Run NetworkDeployment as async task

This commit adds special handling of the NetworkDeployment such that it
will be run as an async task with ansible. This should prevent any
issues where the network configuration causes the ssh connection to drop
and the ansible task to either be unnecessarily retried or failed.

Also added are three variables that can be used to control the async
behavior:

async_deployment: boolean which will toggle running all deployments in
                  async mode.
async_timeout:    timeout in seconds to wait for async tasks
async_poll:       interval in seconds to check async task status

These variables can only be set if running the config-download process
manually, however a future patch could wire them up to Heat parameters.

Change-Id: If1f35980a98a9015ca65f2c6a3e4db04725f1c10
Closes-Bug: #1792343
'}]
commit_message:
Run NetworkDeployment as async task

This commit adds special handling of the NetworkDeployment such that it
will be run as an async task with ansible. This should prevent any
issues where the network configuration causes the ssh connection to drop
and the ansible task to either be unnecessarily retried or failed.

Also added are three variables that can be used to control the async
behavior:

async_deployment: boolean which will toggle running all deployments in
                  async mode.
async_timeout:    timeout in seconds to wait for async tasks
async_poll:       interval in seconds to check async task status

These variables can only be set if running the config-download process
manually, however a future patch could wire them up to Heat parameters.

Change-Id: If1f35980a98a9015ca65f2c6a3e4db04725f1c10
Closes-Bug: #1792343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/12/611712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Set fact for async_deployment set_fact: use_async_deployment: "{{ (async_deployment | default(False)) or (item == 'NetworkDeployment') }}" register: deployment_sync_result when: not use_async_deployment - name: "Run async deployment {{ item }}" shell: | /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/55-heat-config exit $(jq .deploy_status_code /var/lib/heat-config/deployed/{{ deployment_uuid }}.notify.json) become: true environment: HEAT_SHELL_CONFIG: /var/lib/heat-config/tripleo-config-download/{{ item ~ '-' ~ deployment_uuid }} register: deployment_async_result ignore_errors: yes when: use_async_deployment async: "{{ async_timeout | default(300) }}" poll: "{{ async_poll | default(3) }}" - name: "Output for sync deployment {{ item }}" - stderr: "{{ deployment_sync_result.stderr.split('\n') }}" - status_code: "{{ deployment_sync_result.rc }}" failed_when: deployment_sync_result.rc != 0 when: not ansible_check_mode and not use_async_deployment - name: "Output for async deployment {{ item }}" debug: msg: - stderr: "{{ deployment_async_result.stderr.split('\n') }}" - status_code: "{{ deployment_async_result.rc }}" tags: - output failed_when: deployment_async_result.rc != 0 when: not ansible_check_mode and use_async_deployment
deleted_lines: register: deployment_result - name: "Output for {{ item }}" - stderr: "{{ deployment_result.stderr.split('\n') }}" - status_code: "{{ deployment_result.rc }}" failed_when: deployment_result.rc != 0 when: not ansible_check_mode

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-09 12:26:26.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/hacking/checks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/901e8d0d8d0dffb8d4716e7c24c0eb551aacd338', 'message': 'Improve pep8 checking along with hacking

Change-Id: Ic1dd25e99c3db9fc8782a5f0977679978e274191

commit_message:
Improve pep8 checking along with hacking

This change will help to check the function _() is
used but not imported. And the gates will check this missing
in the next time.

Change-Id: Ic1dd25e99c3db9fc8782a5f0977679978e274191
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/33/608933/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # D703: Found use of _() without explicit import of _! UNDERSCORE_IMPORT_FILES = [] string_translation = re.compile(r"[^_]*_\(\s*('|\")") translated_log = re.compile( r"(.)*LOG\.(audit|error|info|warn|warning|critical|exception)" "\(\s*_\(\s*('|\")") underscore_import_check = re.compile(r"(.)*import _(.)*") # We need this for cases where they have created their own _ function. custom_underscore_check = re.compile(r"(.)*_\s*=\s*(.)*") def check_explicit_underscore_import(logical_line, filename): """Check for explicit import of the _ function We need to ensure that any files that are using the _() function to translate logs are explicitly importing the _ function. We can't trust unit test to catch whether the import has been added so we need to check for it here. """ # Build a list of the files that have _ imported. No further # checking needed once it is found. if filename in UNDERSCORE_IMPORT_FILES: pass elif (underscore_import_check.match(logical_line) or custom_underscore_check.match(logical_line)): UNDERSCORE_IMPORT_FILES.append(filename) elif (translated_log.match(logical_line) or string_translation.match(logical_line)): yield(0, "D703: Found use of _() without explicit import of _!") register(check_explicit_underscore_import)

commit_message:
releasenotes: oslo-messaging-separate-backends add project name

Without this patch, the release notes published at
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/openstack-ansible/rocky.html contains
the same line multiple times which is not very clear.

[...]
    Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notifications
    to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.

    Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notifications
    to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.
[...]

Change-Id: I0ed1a43670d97f2e2215d04c641f7bd4cfbe4f44
(cherry picked from commit 161fb3cd8495e71748687b1f6294100c7f310122)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-22 16:06:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-vif/commit/1746518915a8fcc4b0d880cf6b0c8889e0e52f90', 'message': '[WIP] Add abstract OVSDB API

implementation of the API without breaking backwards compatibility.

NOTE: still in progress. Uploaded just for discussion. Tests pending.

commit_message:
Add abstract OVSDB API

Abstract all existing 'ovs-vsctl' calls to an abstract OVSDB API.
This will allow the future addition of a native OVSDB protocol
implementation of the API without breaking backwards compatibility.

Partial-Bug: #1666917
Change-Id: I9ec36be390d713a928a673191008612f3fddad8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/12/476612/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_net_dev(dev): delete_net_dev(dev) set_device_mtu(dev, mtu) set_device_mtu(dev, mtu)def set_device_mtu(dev, mtu):
deleted_lines: import sysfrom vif_plug_ovs import constants from vif_plug_ovs import exceptiondef _ovs_vsctl(args, timeout=None): full_args = ['ovs-vsctl'] if timeout is not None: full_args += ['--timeout=%s' % timeout] full_args += args try: return processutils.execute(*full_args) except Exception as e: LOG.error("Unable to execute %(cmd)s. Exception: %(exception)s", {'cmd': full_args, 'exception': e}) raise exception.AgentError(method=full_args) def _create_ovs_vif_cmd(bridge, dev, iface_id, mac, instance_id, interface_type=None, vhost_server_path=None): cmd = ['--', '--if-exists', 'del-port', dev, '--', 'add-port', bridge, dev, '--', 'set', 'Interface', dev, 'external-ids:iface-id=%s' % iface_id, 'external-ids:iface-status=active', 'external-ids:attached-mac=%s' % mac, 'external-ids:vm-uuid=%s' % instance_id] if interface_type: cmd += ['type=%s' % interface_type] if vhost_server_path: cmd += ['options:vhost-server-path=%s' % vhost_server_path] return cmd def _create_ovs_bridge_cmd(bridge, datapath_type): return ['--', '--may-exist', 'add-br', bridge, '--', 'set', 'Bridge', bridge, 'datapath_type=%s' % datapath_type] @privsep.vif_plug.entrypoint def create_ovs_vif_port(bridge, dev, iface_id, mac, instance_id, mtu=None, interface_type=None, timeout=None, vhost_server_path=None): _ovs_vsctl(_create_ovs_vif_cmd(bridge, dev, iface_id, mac, instance_id, interface_type, vhost_server_path), timeout=timeout) _update_device_mtu(dev, mtu, interface_type, timeout=timeout) @privsep.vif_plug.entrypoint def update_ovs_vif_port(dev, mtu=None, interface_type=None, timeout=None): _update_device_mtu(dev, mtu, interface_type, timeout=timeout) @privsep.vif_plug.entrypoint def delete_ovs_vif_port(bridge, dev, timeout=None): _ovs_vsctl(['--', '--if-exists', 'del-port', bridge, dev], timeout=timeout) _delete_net_dev(dev) def _delete_net_dev(dev): _delete_net_dev(dev) _update_device_mtu(dev, mtu) _update_device_mtu(dev, mtu) @privsep.vif_plug.entrypoint def ensure_ovs_bridge(bridge, datapath_type): _ovs_vsctl(_create_ovs_bridge_cmd(bridge, datapath_type))def _update_device_mtu(dev, mtu, interface_type=None, timeout=120): if not mtu: return if interface_type not in [ constants.OVS_VHOSTUSER_INTERFACE_TYPE, constants.OVS_VHOSTUSER_CLIENT_INTERFACE_TYPE]: if sys.platform != constants.PLATFORM_WIN32: # commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I0ff800d84949f1a02b083b4fcf16e9b82f0d9e57

commit_message:
use payloads for NETWORK BEFORE_DELETE events

This patch switches callbacks to use payloads for BEFORE_DELETE events
of NETWORK resources. To do so the DBEventPayload payload class is used
to encapsulate event data and the respective callback handles are
updated to use the payload kwarg.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I4843073799d4a2478a2583664d972c52457c695c

commit_message:
Revert "file_perms: Skip rpm verification step for Leap 15"

This reverts commit 75e8b0f02a735aaeb8c53ee03e328bd446016bc7.

The openSUSE bug has been fixed so this workaround is not needed
anymore.

Change-Id: I7d8a93332d0ec925d97b64fc1052b1c3d621e066

commit_message:
Introduce Port resource request extension

The resources needed by a port are expressed to nova via
resource_request extending the port.
If the port requested by nova boot has resource_request attribute, that
means that placement must enforce the minimum bandwidth requirements.

Change-Id: I82afa56fa784fc43fefd1ce494bff649f51ad1c8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584903
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

subject: Correct edp-spark workflow dir permission
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-13 12:51:13.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/edp/job_binaries/swift/implementation.py', 'sahara/service/edp/spark/engine.py', 'sahara/service/edp/job_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/8068fceb097fc546b919f90c54e1c2000558b43c', 'message': "Correct edp-spark workflow dir permission

edp spark engine places job binary and workflow
dir on the /tmp directory. The owner of these
files and dor are image user. Whereas spark job
is normally fired as spark user who doesn't
have access to these files. As a result spark
job fail with permission denied error as
shown in the logs provided in story.

This behaviour is visible when the image is
hardened which  changes the default file
permission that are stored in /tmp.

This fix proposes to explicitly provide
required access level on the files
under /tmp that are needed by spark job.

Change-Id: I23dffa7b0b8b44ba2deeb855839cb078d1e44852
Story: #2003414
Task: #24558
"}]
commit_message:
Correct edp-spark workflow dir permission

edp spark engine places job binary and workflow
dir on the /tmp directory. The owner of these
files and dor are image user. Whereas spark job
is normally fired as spark user who doesn't
have access to these files. As a result spark
job fail with permission denied error as
shown in the logs provided in story.

This behaviour is visible when the image is
hardened which  changes the default file
permission that are stored in /tmp.

This fix proposes to explicitly provide
required access level on the files
under /tmp that are needed by spark job.

commit_message:
Enable ingress direction for min_bw rule

Enable QoS minimum-bandwidth rule for ovs and sriov backends for both
ingress and egress directions.
Add qos-bw-limit-direction as supported extension to qos-plugin, and
add create/delete/update_minimum_bandwidth and
delete_minimum_bandwidth_ingress empty methods to sriov/ovs/linuxbridge
extension drivers.

Change-Id: I6eb21ccf0400ea9adae90ff0bf97e08cdb09b8eb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609368
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Fix tgz plan upload error on some OSes

This change adds explicit file extensions to file validation for plan
tarball upload to avoid mime type inconsistencies across different OSes

Story: 2004116
Task: 27539

Change-Id: I7f479fca35a2a72421b68ea528509e1e3b7f3803
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/76/611576/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: validate={file({ accept: 'application/x-gzip, application/gzip, .tgz, .tar.gz' })}

commit_message:
Adjust templating for upgrade scripts.

Cosmetic change to align options within upgrade scripts. E.g:
  openstack overcloud  upgrade converge \
    --overcloud-ssh-user tripleo-admin \
        --templates /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates \
      --stack overcloud \
        --disable-validations \
    --deployed-server ...

To this:
  openstack overcloud  upgrade converge \
      --overcloud-ssh-user tripleo-admin \
      --templates /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates \
      --stack overcloud \
      --disable-validations \
      --deployed-server ...

Change-Id: Id4944a53a3e29c6a4c40aeec49746bce98c4880f

commit_message:
Remove test_rule_create_fail_for_direction_ingress

When the API extension qos-bw-minimum-ingress will be on master (see:
https://review.openstack.org/584927) the test
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_qos.QosMinimumBandwidthRuleTestJSON.
test_rule_create_fail_for_direction_ingress is useless, so it can be
removed from master, and to keep the coverage for stable branches there
should be fullstack test: I6ee08d43aed60a7dd2d3281deaccfac2f3712b33

Change-Id: Ie04d53817c1f28b4756b1cc308203dc77dd2a19c
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Fix next link in get resource list rest API

Fix the issue where `next` link in the response of the REST API, when
used with pagination, gets corrupted and makes it unusable. After this
fix, next link should be readily usable.

Change-Id: Idf45a59e0b07d8306cc82391679fe30a9cd2f0c1
Closes-Bug: #1793344
(cherry picked from commit 08ba20c8d217713a140b90240176bc7959125b62)

commit_message:
Fix rendering of notes and code in major upgrade docs

Some notes and code in major upgrade docs rendered differently than in
the rest of the TripleO docs, it was due to indentation of the blocks
putting them inside a blockquote tag, which messed up the applied CSS
rules.

Change-Id: I3fe17c24115f294c70af145b5e93802f3674f74e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/79/611579/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. code-block:: bash source /home/stack/stackrc openstack overcloud upgrade run --help.. code-block:: bash cat <<EOF > init-repo.yaml parameter_defaults: UpgradeInitCommand: | set -e # -- REPLACE LINES WITH YOUR REPO SWITCH COMMANDS -- curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean.repo https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-queens/current/delorean.repo curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-queens/delorean-deps.repo yum clean all EOF.. note:: Before running the overcloud upgrade prepare ensure you have a valid backup of the current state, including the **undercloud** since there will be a Heat stack update performed here. .. note:: If you have enabled neutron_DVR_ in your deployment you must ensure that compute nodes are connected to the External network via the roles_data.yaml that you will pass using the -r parameter to upgrade prepare. This is necessary to allow floating IP connectivity via the external api network. .. note:: After running the upgrade prepare and until successful completion of the upgrade converge operation, stack updates to the deployment Heat stack are expected to fail. That is, operations such as scaling to add a new node or to apply any new TripleO configuration via Heat stack update **must not** be performed on a Heat stack that has been prepared for upgrade with the 'prepare' command and only consider doing so after running the converge step. See the queens-upgrade-dev-docs_ for more... note:: It is especially important to remember that you **must** include all environment files that were used to deploy the overcloud including the container image references file for the target version container images .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade prepare --templates \ -r /path/to/roles_data.yaml \ -n /path/to/network_data.yaml \ -e <ALL Templates from overcloud-deploy.sh> \ -e init-repo.yaml \ -e containers-prepare-parameter.yaml.. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud config download --config-dir SOMEDIR # playbooks will be downloaded to SOMEDIR directory.. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller.. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller --playbook upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller --playbook deploy_steps_playbook.yaml openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller --playbook post_upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml.. code-block:: bash [root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs status | grep -C 10 -i "error\|fail".. code-block:: bash [root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# docker ps -a.. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes overcloud-compute-0.. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes overcloud-compute-1 \ --playbook upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml # etc for the other 2 as above example for controller.. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller --skip-tags validation.. note:: It is especially important to remember that you **must** include all environment files that were used to deploy the overcloud, including the new container image parameter file. You should omit any repo switch commands and ensure that none of the environment files you are about to use is specifying a value for UpgradeInitCommand. .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade converge --templates -r /path/to/roles_data.yaml \ -n /path/to/network_data.yaml \ -e <ALL Templates from overcloud-deploy.sh> \ -e containers-prepare-parameter.yaml
deleted_lines: .. code-block:: bash source /home/stack/stackrc openstack overcloud upgrade run --help .. code-block:: bash cat <<EOF > init-repo.yaml parameter_defaults: UpgradeInitCommand: | set -e # -- REPLACE LINES WITH YOUR REPO SWITCH COMMANDS -- curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean.repo https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-queens/current/delorean.repo curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-queens/delorean-deps.repo yum clean all EOF .. note:: Before running the overcloud upgrade prepare ensure you have a valid backup of the current state, including the **undercloud** since there will be a Heat stack update performed here. .. note:: If you have enabled neutron_DVR_ in your deployment you must ensure that compute nodes are connected to the External network via the roles_data.yaml that you will pass using the -r parameter to upgrade prepare. This is necessary to allow floating IP connectivity via the external api network. .. note:: After running the upgrade prepare and until successful completion of the upgrade converge operation, stack updates to the deployment Heat stack are expected to fail. That is, operations such as scaling to add a new node or to apply any new TripleO configuration via Heat stack update **must not** be performed on a Heat stack that has been prepared for upgrade with the 'prepare' command and only consider doing so after running the converge step. See the queens-upgrade-dev-docs_ for more. .. note:: It is especially important to remember that you **must** include all environment files that were used to deploy the overcloud including the container image references file for the target version container images .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade prepare --templates \ -r /path/to/roles_data.yaml \ -n /path/to/network_data.yaml \ -e <ALL Templates from overcloud-deploy.sh> \ -e init-repo.yaml \ -e containers-prepare-parameter.yaml .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud config download --config-dir SOMEDIR # playbooks will be downloaded to SOMEDIR directory .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller --playbook upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller --playbook deploy_steps_playbook.yaml openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller --playbook post_upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml .. code-block:: bash [root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs status | grep -C 10 -i "error\|fail" .. code-block:: bash [root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# docker ps -a .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes overcloud-compute-0 .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes overcloud-compute-1 \ --playbook upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml # etc for the other 2 as above example for controller .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller --skip-tags validation .. note:: It is especially important to remember that you **must** include all environment files that were used to deploy the overcloud, including the new container image parameter file. You should omit any repo switch commands and ensure that none of the environment files you are about to use is specifying a value for UpgradeInitCommand. .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud upgrade converge --templates -r /path/to/roles_data.yaml \ -n /path/to/network_data.yaml \ -e <ALL Templates from overcloud-deploy.sh> \ -e containers-prepare-parameter.yaml

commit_message:
Add online data migration docs

Change-Id: If7c562fb743c6f4babd5e14663bdb7f478181c5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/78/611578/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack overcloud external-upgrade run (for online upgrades) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. admonition:: Queens to Rocky :class: qtor The offline (downtime inducing) part of upgrade has finished at this point, and the cloud should be fully operational. Some services have an online component to their upgrade procedure -- operations which don't induce downtime and can run while the cloud operates normally. For OpenStack services these are e.g. online data migrations. Run all these online upgrade operations by executing the following command: .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud external-upgrade run --tags online_upgrade .. note:: If desired, the online upgrades can be run per-service. E.g. to run only Nova online data migrations, execute: .. code-block:: bash openstack overcloud external-upgrade run --tags online_upgrade_nova However, when executing online upgrades in selective parts like this, extra care must be taken to not miss any necessary online upgrade operations.

subject: wheel-build : temporary pip with checksum output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-22 05:11:48.000000000', 'files': ['roles/build-wheels/files/wheel-build.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/8b3532c562ddd644de86e0f0929d0b2d88631cfe', 'message': 'wheel-build : temporary pip with checksum output

We are currently trying to debug persistent wheel corruption.  So far,
we have been completely unable to replicate the corrupt output outside
the periodic jobs.

A first thought was that it was due to AFS corruption due to multiple
writes (I4f8a2f2c6c8164e7ea207f8e4b286e06df0b13dd), however this does
not appear to be the case.

Experimentally manually running the builds, on infra nodes, under
python2 and python3, in parallel just as done here, does not replicate
the problem.

This patched version of pip will output the sha256 hash for the final
build output of each wheel.  The plan is to correlate that against any
corrupt file that appears.  If the corrupt hash matches any file
produced by pip, then we know the problem is inside pip (and we will
have the exact build situation that it occured in); if the corrupt
file does not match then we must have some sort of issue copying the
files or similar.

Change-Id: I81943ed459bf4e2c77cae42e50af5fc5979682b4
'}]
commit_message:
wheel-build : temporary pip with checksum output

We are currently trying to debug persistent wheel corruption.  So far,
we have been completely unable to replicate the corrupt output outside
the periodic jobs.

A first thought was that it was due to AFS corruption due to multiple
writes (I4f8a2f2c6c8164e7ea207f8e4b286e06df0b13dd), however this does
not appear to be the case.

Experimentally manually running the builds, on infra nodes, under
python2 and python3, in parallel just as done here, does not replicate
the problem.

This patched version of pip will output the sha256 hash for the final
build output of each wheel.  The plan is to correlate that against any
corrupt file that appears.  If the corrupt hash matches any file
produced by pip, then we know the problem is inside pip (and we will
have the exact build situation that it occured in); if the corrupt
file does not match then we must have some sort of issue copying the
files or similar.

Change-Id: I81943ed459bf4e2c77cae42e50af5fc5979682b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/34/612234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(ianw) 2018-10-22 This is a temporary hack to get some more # info into the logs to debug corrupt wheels. We should see pip # stamping sha256 hashes into the logs for each wheel, so we can # see if the bad output is coming from pip, or somewhere else. build_env/bin/pip install -e 'git+https://github.com/ianw/pip.git@path-and-hash#egg=pip'

commit_message:
Use limit -1 for nova servers list

By default nova has a limit for returned items in a single response [1].
We should pass limit=-1 to get all items.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/configuration/config.html

Change-Id: I1fabd909c4c0356ef5fcb7c51718fb4513e6befa

commit_message:
Use limit -1 for nova servers list

By default nova has a limit for returned items in a single response [1].
We should pass limit=-1 to get all items.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/configuration/config.html

subject: [Ocata/Pike] Pass DeployIdentifier in upgrade tasks.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-19 10:32:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/65a8ce75f4a1e810c1424c0a6f3a1e77e019595e', 'message': "[Ocata/Pike] Pass DeployIdentifier in upgrade tasks.

The UpdateIdentifier timestamp does not get updated when
running the overcloud deploy command, which is the one used
for upgrading. As a consequence, if the upgrade_tasks managed
to run once they won't be executed again by heat when re-issueing
the upgrade command, as heat considers that the resource did
not change. For this reason, we need to pass DeployIdentifier

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-10-19 10:49:53.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/major_upgrade_steps.j2.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/a23e0a80e0501dbb397950c7456692878e11144e', 'message': "[Ocata/Pike] Pass DeployIdentifier in upgrade tasks.

commit_message:
[Ocata/Pike] Pass DeployIdentifier in upgrade tasks.

The UpdateIdentifier timestamp does not get updated when
running the overcloud deploy command, which is the one used
for upgrading. As a consequence, if the upgrade_tasks managed
to run once they won't be executed again by heat when re-issueing
the upgrade command, as heat considers that the resource did
not change. For this reason, we need to pass DeployIdentifier
which will contain a different timestamp in each execution and
will allow the upgrade_tasks to be executed in the overcloud nodes.

(cherry picked from commit 1a0d1de712e7a1f855ce363b1226d53d0a54b152)
Change-Id: I49cecd8c793519185096fd99713521961022aec9
Closes-Bug: #1795790
Resolves: rhbz#1640982
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/34/611834/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DeployIdentifier: Setting this to a unique value will re-run any deployment tasks which perform configuration on a Heat stack-update. deploy_identifier: {get_param: DeployIdentifier} deploy_identifier: {get_param: DeployIdentifier}

commit_message:
Use Timesync service instead of Ntp

At the moment the 'OS::TripleO::Services::Timesync' service is
synonymous to 'OS::TripleO::Services::Ntp'. Let's use the more generic
Timesync service to pick up the new default in the event the value for
'OS::TripleO::Services::Timesync' changes.

This better aligns with the rest of the roles.

Change-Id: I44f706ce7dd1909ffd3805337fc6d9a5ce6de80f

commit_message:
Remove tripleo.sh entry from developer docs.

The tripleo.sh is not in used anymore now that the
CI has been migrated to zuul v3. This patch removes
the documentation entry explaining its functioning
from Developer docs.

Change-Id: I9a23e95cb8240e0a60c7a18b06d5a81c3fa2872d

commit_message:
Add OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm to OpenShift roles

The OpenShift roles should include the OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm
service for Red Hat Subscription Management so that the provisioned
nodes can register with a Satellite or CDN.

Add the Podman service to OpenShifAllInOne to be more consistent with
other roles.

Change-Id: I08862635c68eddbb0940863c43867ece1b289ee5

Add api-ref for qos-rules-alias extension

Add api-ref for the qos-rules-alias extension.

Change-Id: I6d2d32f89e04a8ad83fae2a1183d572221881b90

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/66/610666/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================== Quality of Service rules alias API ================================== Deletes, shows information for, and updates QoS rules through alias API end points. The purpose of this API extension is to enable callers to execute the QoS rules delete, show and update requests without specifying the corresponding policy ID. Otherwise, these requests have the exact same behavior as their counterparts described in other parts of this documentation. The requests available in this API extension are: Show bandwidth limit rule details ================================= .. rest_method:: GET /v2.0/qos/bandwidth_limit_rules/{rule_id} Update bandwidth limit rule =========================== .. rest_method:: PUT /v2.0/qos/bandwidth_limit_rules/{rule_id} Delete bandwidth limit rule =========================== .. rest_method:: DELETE /v2.0/qos/bandwidth_limit_rules/{rule_id} Show DSCP marking rule details ============================== .. rest_method:: GET /v2.0/qos/dscp_marking_rules/{dscp_rule_id} Update DSCP marking rule ======================== .. rest_method:: PUT /v2.0/qos/dscp_marking_rules/{dscp_rule_id} Delete DSCP marking rule ======================== .. rest_method:: DELETE /v2.0/qos/dscp_marking_rules/{dscp_rule_id} Show minimum bandwidth rule details =================================== .. rest_method:: GET /v2.0/qos/minimum_bandwidth_rules/{rule_id} Update minimum bandwidth rule ============================= .. rest_method:: PUT /v2.0/qos/minimum_bandwidth_rules/{rule_id} Delete minimum bandwidth rule ============================= .. rest_method:: DELETE /v2.0/qos/minimum_bandwidth_rules/{rule_id}

subject: No IPA to conductor communication
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 22:22:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs/commit/9d41290dd52464127c91dbb7b7b2e65937ac7112', 'message': 'No IPA to conductor communication

Allowing a target node to contact the Ironic API as part of the boot
process, carries the implication that an attacker could then launch an
attack on the control plane via the Ironic API.

In this spec we provide a means to push the node ID to a target node, and poll
the target node for completed build state. Thus all network traffic
egresses from conductor to IPA, and never the other way around

Change-Id: Ief9fb2ecdf8dd7c071328ca73baad87ff711f22f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-12 22:40:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs/commit/3d492b74d5d244b7f804f9cc34c0521db661eb61', 'message': 'No IPA to conductor communication

attack on the control plane via the Ironic API.

In this spec we provide a means to push the node ID to a target node,
and poll the target node for completed build state. Thus all network
traffic egresses from conductor to IPA, and never the other way around

Co-Authored-By: Mario Villaplana <mario.villaplana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>
Change-Id: Ief9fb2ecdf8dd7c071328ca73baad87ff711f22f

commit_message:
No IPA to conductor communication

Allowing a target node to contact the Ironic API as part of the boot
process carries the implication that an attacker could then launch an
attack on the control plane via the Ironic API.

In this spec we provide a means to push the node ID to a target node,
and poll the target node for completed build state. Thus all network
traffic egresses from conductor to IPA, and never the other way around

Story: 1526486
Task: 10377
Co-Authored-By: Mario Villaplana <mario.villaplana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
Change-Id: Ief9fb2ecdf8dd7c071328ca73baad87ff711f22f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/06/212206/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== No IPA to conductor communication ================================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/no-ipa-conductor-communication Pass the node ID to the target node as a kernel parameter rather than requiring (or allowing) the target to have any API access to the ironic API. * If your specification proposes any changes to the Ironic REST API such as changing parameters which can be returned or accepted, or even the semantics of what happens when a client calls into the API, then you should add the APIImpact flag to the commit message. Specifications with the APIImpact flag can be found with the following query: Problem description =================== As part of the boot process IPA must call the ironic API to query its node ID, and notify ironic when it's completed the boot process. When using a flat network model, this means that any node in a datacenter has logical network access to the control plane. If a node is compromised it could be used to launch an attack against Ironic, and subsequently gain control of the provisioning process. The (potential) security problem: * Bob boots a host with Ironic, this host is publicly routable to the internet. Mallory finds and compromises this host. She then attacks the ironic API from this host. Once she compromises the Ironic API, she then starts booting other hosts in the datacenter with a compromised disk image. She has now owned an entire datacenter. To remediate this we'll pass the node ID to the instance as a kernel parameter in the PXE data. In this case, even though Mallory has compromised the target node, she cannot use that to attack the provisioning infrastructure. Proposed change =============== We will add a config option to put IPA communications into a 'ipa_poll_only' mode. If 'ipa_poll_only' is enabled, we pass the 'standalone' kernel command line parameter to IPA to disable heartbeating and lookup. The conductor will pass the node UUID as a kernel command line parameter when IPA boots, and IPA will use that instead of doing a lookup call to Ironic. If 'ipa_poll_only' is enabled, the conductor will use a periodic task to query each agent at a set interval, instead of querying the agent after a heartbeat is received. This periodic task will only query nodes in states IPA would normally be heartbeating in: (DEPLOY*, DELETE*, CLEAN*, ZAP*). For this mode, we will also need to remove the ipa_url being passed as kernel parameter to the agent. If 'ipa_poll_only' is True, the heartbeat endpoint for nodes should ignore any requests. This will ensure that when the conductor is restarted to change this option, from False to True, there won't be duplicated heart Alternatives ------------ Keep having IPA only support the mode that queries Ironic for its node ID. Separate the deploying (provisioning) network and tenant network is one possibility. However this doesn't scale for very large deployers, particularly those on L3 network. Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- All the agent_* vendor passthru interfaces will need to be refactor to allow either a heartbeat call or a periodic task to drive the states. Changes which affect the driver API have a direct effect on all drivers, and often have a wider impact on the system. There are several things to consider in this section. Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- This change will prevent a malicious actor from using IPA as a vector of attack against the Ironic API. Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ Polling target nodes for state from the conductor could have scale issues when managing many thousands of nodes. Performance Impact ------------------ If the polling is not implemented in a sufficiently parallel way, it could introduce a serious delay in periodic processes. Other deployer impact --------------------- We should document that the deployer needs to set this flag on any conductor using an agent_* driver, or some nodes will be heartbeating and others will not. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: <joshnang> Other contributors: <penick> Work Items ---------- * write the code Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== This feature needs to be documented as a deployment option. References ========== None

commit_message:
[DNM]Test experimental Zuul jobs

After this patch [1] has been merged for a while, it seems that all the
experimental Zuul jobs fail completely. This patch is to check these
jobs and try to fix them with other patches in the future.

[1].https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533137/

Change-Id: Ie2174dafbd579317924a2e071a0bc997ac367544
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-21 15:01:31.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.i18n/commit/a3b57341473bec9ebbd4c6e5d1aa05bb182ff8d7', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Change-Id: Ie4d4b59ec6cf383875613b2fce6a7db0fdeab1db

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ie4d4b59ec6cf383875613b2fce6a7db0fdeab1db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.i18n refs/changes/81/612181/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stestr run {posargs}

subject: Preserve compute stats used by the scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-19 11:39:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2eaf7a6dbdcf60e7b641be93f951a5285c34839d', 'message': "Preserve compute stats used by the scheduler

The HostState object which is used by the scheduler is using the 'stats'
property of the compute node to derive its own values. These values are
used for both filtering and weighing compute hosts. However, the 'stats'
property of the compute node is cleared in RT._copy_resources() and then
populated again as part of update_available_resources(). This creates a
race condition between RT and scheduler which may result into populating
wrong values for 'num_io_ops' and 'num_instances' into the HostState object
and thus leading to incorrect scheduling decisions.

This patch fixes this by preserving all stats which are used by the
scheduler.

Change-Id: Ie36adc33ffdb1a7fc3a5c0a47ad618c4862c2ab9
Closes-Bug: #1798806
"}]
commit_message:
Preserve compute stats used by the scheduler

The HostState object which is used by the scheduler is using the 'stats'
property of the compute node to derive its own values. These values are
used for both filtering and weighing compute hosts. However, the 'stats'
property of the compute node is cleared in RT._copy_resources() and then
populated again as part of update_available_resources(). This creates a
race condition between RT and scheduler which may result into populating
wrong values for 'num_io_ops' and 'num_instances' into the HostState object
and thus leading to incorrect scheduling decisions.

This patch fixes this by preserving all stats which are used by the
scheduler.

Change-Id: Ie36adc33ffdb1a7fc3a5c0a47ad618c4862c2ab9
Closes-Bug: #1798806
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/611852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(rgerganov): Preserve some of the stats properties which are # used by the scheduler for filtering and weighing prev_num_instances = stats.get('num_instances', 0) prev_io_workload = stats.get('io_workload', 0) stats['num_instances'] = prev_num_instances stats['io_workload'] = prev_io_workload
deleted_lines: # NOTE(danms): Preserve 'failed_builds' across the stats clearing, # as that is not part of resources

Change-Id: I120a98cc4c11772f24099081ef3ac44a50daf71d
Closes-Bug: #1729621
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2017-12-22 09:33:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bee5a3efc8f9fa6aa8fed5a54c9345188060f3f5', 'message': "Update resources once in update_available_resource

This change ensures that resources are updated only once per
update_available_resource() call.

Compute resources were previously updated during host
object initialization and at the end of
update_available_resource(). It could cause inconsistencies
in resource tracking between compute host and DB for couple
of second when final _update() at the end of
update_available_resource() is beign called.

For example: nova-api shows that host uses 10GB of RAM, but
in fact its 12GB because DB doesn't have resources that belongs
to shutdown instance.

Because of that fact nova-scheduler (CachingScheduler) could
choose (based on imcomplete information) host which is already full.

For more informations please see realted bug: #1729621

Change-Id: I120a98cc4c11772f24099081ef3ac44a50daf71d
Closes-Bug: #1729621

commit_message:
Update resources once in update_available_resource

This change ensures that resources are updated only once per
update_available_resource() call.

Compute resources were previously updated during host
object initialization and at the end of
update_available_resource(). It could cause inconsistencies
in resource tracking between compute host and DB for couple
of second when final _update() at the end of
update_available_resource() is being called.

For example: nova-api shows that host uses 10GB of RAM, but
in fact its 12GB because DB doesn't have resources that belongs
to shutdown instance.

Because of that fact nova-scheduler (CachingScheduler) could
choose (based on imcomplete information) host which is already full.

For more informations please see realted bug: #1729621

Change-Id: I120a98cc4c11772f24099081ef3ac44a50daf71d
Closes-Bug: #1729621
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/520024/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _init_compute_node(self, context, resources, populate=True): :param populate: populate to database and scheduler if populate: self._update(context, cn) if populate: self._update(context, cn) if populate: self._update(context, cn) # NOTE(mjozefcz): Do not populate resources at this stage, # only initialize compute host object. # Populate them at the end of this function to make process # more unit(?). # See bug #1729621 self._init_compute_node(context, resources, populate=False)
deleted_lines: def _init_compute_node(self, context, resources): self._update(context, cn) self._update(context, cn) self._update(context, cn) self._init_compute_node(context, resources)

subject: Healthmanager shouldn't update NO_MONITOR members
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-09 19:05:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/af3377a0670e8b2df61d7d9ca1fa231e053aacb4', 'message': "Healthmanager shouldn't update NO_MONITOR members

During a create of a member on a pool with no healthmonitor, there is a
chance the member will be briefly updated to OFFLINE incorrectly.

The flow of events:
1. A Member is created in DB in NO_MONITOR.
2. A Member is passed to the handler.
3. A health message comes in, not including the member.
4. The Member is present in the DB but missing from the Amp, and is
   set to OFFLINE status.
5. The Member is created on the amp.
6. Another health messages comes in, and the Member is put back in the
   correct NO_MONITOR state.

Change-Id: I74c8cda0c7da88fedf652215630c701bb2761eef
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-09 21:19:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/127cbf97f42f7a37a94416eaf6575bdba55b5e5e', 'message': "Healthmanager shouldn't update NO_MONITOR members

During a create of a member on a pool with no healthmonitor, there is a
chance the member will be briefly updated to OFFLINE incorrectly.

The flow of events:
1. A Member is created in DB in NO_MONITOR.
2. A Member is passed to the handler.
3. A health message comes in, not including the member.
4. The Member is present in the DB but missing from the Amp, and is
   set to OFFLINE status.
5. The Member is created on the amp.
6. Another health messages comes in, and the Member is put back in the
   correct NO_MONITOR state.

Change-Id: I74c8cda0c7da88fedf652215630c701bb2761eef
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-05-09 21:20:50.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/controller/healthmanager/health_drivers/test_update_db.py', 'octavia/controller/healthmanager/health_drivers/update_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/267114fc90e2fa1e40114553cedd4fea4d2a8225', 'message': "Healthmanager shouldn't update NO_MONITOR members

During a create of a member on a pool with no healthmonitor, there is a
chance the member will be briefly updated to OFFLINE incorrectly.

The flow of events:
1. A Member is created in DB in NO_MONITOR.
2. A Member is passed to the handler.
3. A health message comes in, not including the member.
4. The Member is present in the DB but missing from the Amp, and is
   set to OFFLINE status.
5. The Member is created on the amp.
6. Another health messages comes in, and the Member is put back in the
   correct NO_MONITOR state.

Change-Id: I74c8cda0c7da88fedf652215630c701bb2761eef
"}]
commit_message:
Healthmanager shouldn't update NO_MONITOR members

During a create of a member on a pool with no healthmonitor, there is a
chance the member will be briefly updated to OFFLINE incorrectly.

The flow of events:
1. A Member is created in DB in NO_MONITOR.
2. A Member is passed to the handler.
3. A health message comes in, not including the member.
4. The Member is present in the DB but missing from the Amp, and is
   set to OFFLINE status.
5. The Member is created on the amp.
6. Another health messages comes in, and the Member is put back in the
   correct NO_MONITOR state.

Change-Id: I74c8cda0c7da88fedf652215630c701bb2761eef

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I068ac92a340a5a31af53f77b69a702c5c138b4c8

commit_message:
Fix help message of user_unique_last_password_count

If we want to use identity.user_unique_last_password_count, we must
firstly set identity-feature-enabled.security_compliance to True,
whose default value is False.
So this is to fix the help message of user_unique_last_password_count
to mention this.

Change-Id: I0979c468b67957309a5c877f084eaf4c47007e6d

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I123b7167bacca583d26a8f796554904ad15f1535

commit_message:
Base framework for cinder-status upgrade check

This adds the cinder-status CLI for performing upgrade checks as part of
the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal. It only includes a placeholder
for actual checks. Follow up patches will need to be added for anything
we identify as needing specific checking.

Story: 2003657
Task: 26123
Change-Id: I2e532d313d12e60848b17e869882e52ec456929b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/81/610581/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cinder-status = cinder.cmd.status:main

commit_message:
Use different base virtual_router_id on openshift

With the default setting, the keepalived that we deploy on the master
node collides with the one that is setup on the undercloud. We simply
need to use a different virtual_router_id_base to prevent
virtual_router_id collision.

Change-Id: I92ef081a111f93ddce4ec42400bcb648b7f7def0

subject: make user_info_endpoint_url independent of auth_url
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-21 12:18:05.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/auth/keycloak.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/ef1b65baed2beeb713a1c5406be70233015a612f', 'message': 'make user_info_endpoint_url independent of auth_url

Client should be able to create a token using “auth_url” (e.g. ”https://keycloak:7443/auth”)
Server should be able to validate the token using “user_info_endpoint_url” (e.g. “https://cbnd:9443/something/custom”)
also be backward compatible

(cherry picked from commit ae23de737dae96fb73e148d496214a5a09dcc2a0)

Change-Id: I7561f00d4239567a258c1eb0a610be62d9dc90ce
'}]
commit_message:
make user_info_endpoint_url independent of auth_url

Client should be able to create a token using “auth_url” (e.g. ”https://keycloak:7443/auth”)
Server should be able to validate the token using “user_info_endpoint_url” (e.g. “https://cbnd:9443/something/custom”)
also be backward compatible

(cherry picked from commit ae23de737dae96fb73e148d496214a5a09dcc2a0)

Change-Id: I7561f00d4239567a258c1eb0a610be62d9dc90ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/61/612161/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: user_info_endpoint_url = CONF.keycloak_oidc.user_info_endpoint_url if user_info_endpoint_url.startswith(('http://', 'https://')): user_info_endpoint = user_info_endpoint_url else: user_info_endpoint = ( ("%s" + user_info_endpoint_url) % (CONF.keycloak_oidc.auth_url, realm_name))

commit_message:
Remove keymgr_api_class option

The keymgr_api_class parameter has been deprecated for one year.
We can remove it.

Change-Id: I175ebda047ecda8a8f98b12f96d39b7c989949ac
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611223
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/08/611208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: context 'with barbican deprecated parameters' do let :params do { :keymgr_api_class => 'castellan.key_manager.barbican_key_manager.BarbicanKeyManager', } end it 'should set keymgr parameter' do is_expected.to contain_nova_config('key_manager/backend').with_value('castellan.key_manager.barbican_key_manager.BarbicanKeyManager') is_expected.to contain_package('cryptsetup').with( :ensure => 'present' ) end end

Add framework for blazar-status upgrade check

upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.

future.

commit_message:
Clear all l3 related namespace before starting neutron-l3-agent only when l3_ha is enable

If we are not using l3 ha mode, it’s not necessary to delete the namespaces related to l3. It will speed up the start of the neutron l3 agent.

Change-Id: I78f6d927a78e8f9e4ed855e4b6d1362bdfc6b985
Closes-Bug: #1785880
(cherry picked from commit 353230a17e91f65977706944202f52c8da4fe827)

added_lines: {% if enable_neutron_agent_ha | bool %}{% endif %}

commit_message:
AppArmor profile improvements for Fibre Channel

Add various AppArmor rules required to support FibreChannel disk
attachments, specifically tested against the HP 3Par driver but should
work generically.

/dev/sd* is required as nova code checks if the device is readable
(os-brick/os_brick/initiator/connectors/base.py:check_valid_device)

Change-Id: I943fa27e033884d9ab88a510424debc15e27c207

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I34c1e80513b3896627144cae1748207d640c6495

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I51fb01c0ae18ba2c249646d1197922a3f9297f7a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress-specs refs/changes/22/606622/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
comment out stein section of toctree

There are no stein specs, so using a glob pattern to include them in the
output causes a warning which then breaks the build. Comment that
toctree out for now.

Change-Id: I97ca5dae30e59023256e6368aa98953f7cb157dd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I2190313c77f69c3cabc6e60c2e18762ccebdc7cc
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Convert Normalizing filter to flask native Middleware

Normalizing filter has been converted to a flask-native style
middleware instead of leaning on the old application logic from
Webob. We also now strip all trailing slashes, not just a single
traling slash.

Test Changes:

* test_url_middleware now tests the new middleware directly instead
  of leaning on webob and fake requests.

Change-Id: I5f82817b61a9284b97cf6443105107150d4a1757
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Support patch rows to datasources

Example:

$ openstack congress datasource row patch <datasource id/name> \
       <table id> <patch operations string>
$ openstack congress datasource row patch push table0 '
[{"op":"add", "value":{"col1": "val1", "col2": "val2"}}]'

Change-Id: I89744b86e13df945430cb3c8bb0af9d69d16cace
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-congressclient refs/changes/12/535012/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def patch_datasource_rows(self, datasource_name, table_name, body=None): """Patch rows in a table of a datasource. Args: datasource_name: Name or id of the datasource table_name: Table name for updating body: list of patch operations. """ resp, body = self.httpclient.patch(self.datasource_rows % (datasource_name, table_name), body=body) return body

commit_message:
Add WSGI support script for cyborg API

Control Plane API endpoints deployment via WSGI [1] was a community goal
in Pike release. This method provides a series of advantages over that
of running api via a Python command that runs a web server.

This patch add scripts for running API services via WSGI.
The follow-up patch will add the devstack install support.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/deploy-api-in-wsgi.html

Change-Id: Ifb0ae2fa2143236fb9b38d230f2604e4e560e66e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/92/611792/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: wsgi_scripts = cyborg-wsgi-api = cyborg.api.wsgi_app:init_application

commit_message:
Readd get_openstack_logo_path

Change I594136a0ea66d61f60dafc6a853137470efc7d42 broke the API of this
package with renaming get_openstack_logo_path which broke a couple
of users, readd it.

Change-Id: Ia2f6760e0f6f53d94a8d3358d5c4e2fe0a2d7bf3

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I24d6d5ddbe337a3de68ec7de8564adf2bfecdd6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-repos refs/changes/93/609193/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stestr run {posargs}

commit_message:
Set default paths for OpenStack

Several previous openstackdocstheme deployments
used get_pdf_theme_path() and get_openstack_logo_path()
without arguments. This patch adds default arguments as 'openstack'
to correctly work on such deployments.

Change-Id: I23a5ae26b3367514a8e531925f93ddc97d56f6be

commit_message:
Bug fix: add missing fields required when adding deployables

Fix the broken database insertion code for deployables & accelerators
tables which is not compatible with new scheme anymore.

- add `interface_type` missing in Intel FPGA driver
- insert device records into `accelerators` table 
- pass the ids of accelerators into `deployables` as `accelerator_id` 

Change-Id: If3e563f2532247eee267d1aab011899b5806c5f1

commit_message:
Pass in `region_name` to get correct heat endpoint

In a multi regions openstack cloud, when user create a cluster in the
one region, heat-container-agent may try to get stack data from the
other regions and will definitely fail because currently
heat-container-agent doesn't pass "region_name" when searching for
Heat endpoints. This patch fixes the issue by passing the region
name.

Please refer the fix Iec6f3606c9fdf8474f393b0990356f34d38bcf75 on
Heat side.

Task: 22627
Story: 2002768

Change-Id: I88016482e887ce0b0fa309199abd27cf0e777e2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/43/579043/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: project_id=iv['deploy_project_id'], region_name=iv['deploy_region_name']) project_id=iv['deploy_project_id'], region_name=iv['deploy_region_name'])

commit_message:
Invalidate app cred AFTER deletion

Invalidate the application credential after deletion, not before.
This prevents timing issues where an app_cred could remain active
after deletion.

Change-Id: I14748bf2399e5da4ee360f451a8050f25dd90803
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/21/611121/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.driver.delete_application_credential(application_credential_id)

commit_message:
Add framework for zun-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of zun-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I952bfe49fefb007b8f3d3e05b049527f401f26e9
Story: 2003657
Task: 26166

commit_message:
Add support for cinder backend availability zones

Add the ability to override the "backend_availability_zone" parameter
in every cinder volume backend.

Implements: blueprint split-controlplane-cinder-volume-az
Depends-On: I11821a38d8ba5afc594b3d601cd1634207a6f093
Change-Id: Ic407b747474b567858ad36beabc8a7d8c5022343

added_lines: backend_availability_zone => hiera('cinder::backend::veritas_hyperscale::backend_availability_zone', undef)

commit_message:
Provide a region to the K8S Fedora Atomic config

Kubernetes should initialize its Global configuration for the OpenStack
provider with the region specified in the Heat stack.
This will allow user to create Magnum Kubernetes clusters in
multiregional OpenStack installation with different public endpoint for
services.

Task: 22576
Story: 2002728
Change-Id: I66820369b889e16445cad7a48cd0f458aae1c41f
(cherry picked from commit a28e5609f991ce32255f7badcad2514ca8e66ab8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/00/612200/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Corrected release config location for log collection

Fixes problem where log collection was using config files from
old location after we already switched deployment to use new location.

This was not observed because the file content was the same but
once we attempted to remove the old files we discovered the issue.

Prepares for removal of config files from their old location.

Change-Id: I70aeb3724d6d162aa6d8b00024f3ce1a74dbf79f
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/7

commit_message:
Use keystone_auth for credentials

Magnum requires credentials to be stored inside keystone_auth
in order to be able to properly talk to other services.  This
patch addresses that and moves those settings in the right place.

Change-Id: I8e8b3f769ae58aa8d7ceb22eaf264865790afeed

commit_message:
Disable sending metrics for clusters

There is a reported issue in Magnum which makes clusters fail
to provision if the cluster stat reporting is enabled with
Kuberentes 4.0.0

This patch disables it as the recommended workaround until this
is resolved upstream.

Change-Id: I91d4873d94ce85a0768c441df9e0701da1706115

commit_message:
Bugfix: Add datasource_name to an entity also on update

The vitrage_datasource_name property should
be added to every vertex, to allow its late
deletion by the consistency enforcer if
needed [1].
Until now this property was added only at
vertex creation. It should be added also at
vertex update.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588219/

Change-Id: I49a0a008b18805cc247cbe1c7b9ccf156c4bae9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/38/610338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use sync action get_deployment_failures

Instead of using the workflow, which has the extra overhead of opening a
websocket and polling for messages and the workflow result, just use the
mistral action for get_deployment_failures directly. This is much
simpler.

It also fixes a bug where messages from other running workflows using
the same "tripleo" queue were polluting the output of the "overcloud
failures" command.

Change-Id: Ie774a5698515ba7e43dc0755042fb476eb241fc7
Closes-Bug: #1794277

added_lines: result = base.call_action( 'tripleo.deployment.get_deployment_failures', **workflow_input if result.get('message', ''): print(result['message']) return result['failures']
deleted_lines: tripleoclients = clients.tripleoclient execution = base.start_workflow( 'tripleo.deployment.v1.get_deployment_failures', workflow_input=workflow_input with tripleoclients.messaging_websocket() as ws: for payload in base.wait_for_messages(workflow_client, ws, execution, _WORKFLOW_TIMEOUT): if 'message' in payload: print(payload['message']) if payload['status'] == 'SUCCESS': return payload['deployment_failures']['failures'] else: raise exceptions.WorkflowServiceError( 'Exception getting deployment failures: {}'.format( payload.get('message', '')))

commit_message:
Skip deployments with no uuid

If a deployment is not triggered for whatever stack operation is in
progress, instead of having a uuid for the deployment value, Heat just
substitutes the resource name of TripleOSoftwareDeployment.

This needs to be handled in the config download code so that we don't
try and query the Heat API for a deployment with that name which will
just result in a 404 Not found.

Change-Id: If4575498387e9dee94a9ebd75353a2a8bf719072
Closes-Bug: #1798439

subject: Don't add tarball to config-download dir
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-03 20:15:47.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/utils/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/356334b131a19b3273daf8a114682adad6693435', 'message': "Don't add tarball to config-download dir

GitPyton's repo.index.add defaults to force adding all ignored file
patterns from .gitignore. This was causing the generated
overcloud-config.tar.gz to also be included in the git repo. This caused
the config-download directory to recursivley grow larger in size as each
commit contained a tarball of the whole repo.

Using repo.git.add instead allows the .gitignore to be honored so that
the tarball isn't included in any commits.

Change-Id: I5c7b4fc448d957e30c0ea386795c9b698e9febed
Closes-Bug: #1795949
"}]
commit_message:
Don't add tarball to config-download dir

GitPyton's repo.index.add defaults to force adding all ignored file
patterns from .gitignore. This was causing the generated
overcloud-config.tar.gz to also be included in the git repo. This caused
the config-download directory to recursivley grow larger in size as each
commit contained a tarball of the whole repo.

Using repo.git.add instead allows the .gitignore to be honored so that
the tarball isn't included in any commits.

Change-Id: I5c7b4fc448d957e30c0ea386795c9b698e9febed
Closes-Bug: #1795949
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/01/607701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use repo.git.add directly as repo.index.add defaults to forcing # commit of ignored files, which we don't want. repo.git.add('.')

commit_message:
make user_info_endpoint_url independent of auth_url

Client should be able to create a token using “auth_url” (e.g. ”https://keycloak:7443/auth”)
Server should be able to validate the token using “user_info_endpoint_url” (e.g. “https://cbnd:9443/something/custom”)
also be backward compatible

Change-Id: I437fde40345af52483cc764e5dc6a1f55f1b3e88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/39/610339/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Gates: Update fluent-logging/elasticsearch configurations

This updates the fluentd buffer output configurations to account
for the restraints of the jobs deploying fluentd. This also
renames the fluentd configuration key from td_agent to fluentd to
reflect the fact we're no longer deploying td-agent

This also updates the Elasticsearch default replicas and overrides
the replica counts in each Elasticsearch deployment to account for
resource constraints

Change-Id: I55dee410eced99c3e1645f7452e4306ad646e601
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/60/611860/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: td_agent: flush_thread_count: 2 num_threads: 8 flush_thread_count: 2 num_threads: 8 flush_thread_count: 2 num_threads: 8

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2018-10-09 16:21:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/d08fb6fa89fa787dc2ce6051a0b03c152f00e323', 'message': 'WIP: Reduce scope of single node gates

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2018-10-09 16:30:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/00272dee2f8073b15c49fe323064bb3b26925656', 'message': 'WIP: Organize aio gates by function

This organizes the single node gates for osh-infra by function.
This organization aims to improve the single node gates in the
following ways:

1. Reduce number of services deployed in single node jobs
2. Only deploy Ceph for logging job, as Elasticsearch requires
   RGW for snapshot repositories.
3. Use NFS for storage for monitoring job, as Ceph is not a
   requirement for any of the services here.
4. Remove duplicate services deployed to multiple single node jobs
5. Remove storage from openstack-support job, as the only service
   requiring storage is rabbitmq. Rabbitmq is deployed with
   storage enabled in the openstack-helm checks/gates.

This also removes the documentation for the single node deployments,
as those deployments do not make sense with this change. This should
be revisited as a follow-on once we have a clear path forward for
the larger gate refactoring work

Change-Id: I46951f76904fa2ab245a202d55f76019b7503362
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2018-10-09 18:46:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/4e1af518fb1d542d6730e18c2ba5fd5590289017', 'message': 'WIP: Organize aio gates by function
